prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism with a Curved Top Edge** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. For this part, the euler angles are set to 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 degrees, and the translation vector is set to 0.0, 0.5461, 0.0. This will position and orient the part relatively to any previously built parts. Next, we will create the 2D sketch for this part. In the current coordinate system, draw a rectangle and a curved shape on two separate planes. **Face 1:** - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.7282), End Point (0.0, 0.75) - Line 2: Start Point (0.0, 0.75), End Point (0.091, 0.75) - Arc 1: Start Point (0.091, 0.75), Mid Point (0.1966, 0.7063), End Point (0.2403, 0.6007) - Line 3: Start Point (0.2403, 0.6007), End Point (0.2184, 0.6007) - Arc 2: Start Point (0.2184, 0.6007), Mid Point (0.1811, 0.6908), End Point (0.091, 0.7282) - Line 4: Start Point (0.091, 0.7282), End Point (0.0, 0.7282) This loop forms one face of the rectangular prism with a curved top edge. **Face 2:** - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point (0.2184, 0), End Point (0.2403, 0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.2403, 0), End Point (0.2403, 0.6007) - Line 3: Start Point (0.2403, 0.6007), End Point (0.2184, 0.6007) - Line 4: Start Point (0.2184, 0.6007), End Point (0.2184, 0) This loop is a rectangle that forms the other face of the rectangular prism. After creating the 2D sketch, scale it by a factor of 0.75, specified by the `sketch_scale` parameter. Then, transform this scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the given euler angles and translation vector. The final step is to extrude the scaled 2D sketch along the normal vector up to specified depth (0.5461) to create the 3D model of this part. The final shape will have a length of 0.75, width of 0.5461, and height of 0.75.</description>
